lead_paragraph: WERKMAN--Sidney, M.D.,died at 88 on February 28th, 2016. He was a Professor of Psychiatry at the University of Colorado School of Medicine before returning to his birthplace, Washington, DC, to finish his career at Georgetown Medical School. His books include: The Role of Psychiatry in Medical Education (1966), Only a Little Time (1972), and Bringing Up Children Overseas, (1977). In addition, he wrote or contributed to more than 80 scientific articles and chapters in medical texts. He is survived by Nancy M. Folger, Russell Werkman (son by his first wife, Alexandra Colt Werkman, deceased, about whom he wrote Only a Little Time), and their families. He is dearly missed. A full obituary is at: http://www.legacy.com/ obituaries/name/sidney- werkman-obituary?pid= 1000000177918778. Please make donations to Young Concert Artists, 250 West 57th Street, Suite 1222, New York, NY, 10107 or the Sitar Arts Center, 1700 Kalorama Road, NW Suite 101, Washington, DC 20009. A memorial service will be held at St. Alban's Church in Washington, DC at 11am on April 30th. 1/3
